glsa.title: Adobe Acrobat Reader: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Adobe Acrobat Reader is vulnerable to remote code execution, Denial of Service, and cross-site request forgery attacks.

background.p: Adobe Acrobat Reader is a PDF reader released by Adobe.

description.p: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Adobe Acrobat Reader, including:

ul.li: A file disclosure when using file:// in PDF documents (CVE-2007-1199)
Multiple buffer overflows in unspecified Javascript methods (CVE-2007-5659)
An unspecified vulnerability in the Escript.api plugin (CVE-2007-5663)
An integer overflow when passing incorrect arguments to "printSepsWithParams" (CVE-2008-0726)

description.p: Other unspecified vulnerabilities have also been reported (CVE-2008-0655).

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted document, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application. A remote attacker could also perform cross-site request forgery attacks, or cause a Denial of Service.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Adobe Acrobat Reader users should upgrade to the latest version:
